text: Nico Lemoine (born April 10, 2000) is an American soccer player who plays as a midfielder for Houston Dynamo in Major League Soccer. == Career == === Youth === Lemoine spent time with De Anza Force before joining the San Jose Earthquakes academy. He would spend time training with the Earthquakes USL affiliate club, Reno 1868, during the summer of 2017. Lemoine joined the Houston Dynamo academy during 2018. He would lead the Dynamo U-19s with six assists during the 2018 U.S. Soccer Development Academy season. === Senior === Lemoine signed a contract with the Dynamo's USL Championship affiliate, Rio Grande Valley FC, ahead of the 2019 season. He made his professional debut on March 23, coming on as a substitute in a 2–2 draw with El Paso Locomotive. In the Toros next game, Lemoine scored his first professional goal in a 2–1 loss to the Tulsa Roughnecks. On September 15 he scored in a 2–1 loss to Sacramento Republic.
